Object Flight Path: Path with directional change,Path then hovering
trends: There have been no other sightings in Linthicum
This sighting has never been favorited.
divs: sighting detailsin 1967, i was 12 years old, in 7th grade. my mother and i, along with a friend, had gone to my grandparents' home on airport property to collect their mail while they were away. this was in the area of linthicum [near glen burnie, between baltimore & annapolis, near what is now baltimore washington international] the b&o railroad ran parallel to baltimore & annapolis blvd. we were driving up poplar ave towards the tracks when my mother stopped the car. something was traveling above the tracks, moving slowly, from right to left. it appeared cigar shaped, but maybe have been a disc, but looked different because of the angle. it was silver, but not shiny. more of a brushed metallic finish. this was not an airplane. i grew up at the airport, and spent as much time there than i think i did at school. planes i knew. this craft\ship\vehicle had multi-colored lights down the side that 'chased' firing quickly and gave the vessel the appearance of moving more quickly than it actually was. it was large, bigger than a locomotive. it was perfectly silent. we watched for about ten, perhaps 15 minutes as it travelled up the tracks, and gradually descended into the gully where the tracks ran, then quickly, it climbed up above the trees, made a hard right and sped off into the sky. we weren't afraid. it was facinating, and there was a sense of wonderment about the whole episode. this same craft was reported in the baltimore sun paper as having been seen in the area of hampton roads va, where it went underwater and traveled north, then surfaced at the mouth of the chesepeake bay. the sighting was reported by telephone to the tower at friendship airport and the civil air patrol, but there was never any report made. my mother and i were two of the witnesses. my grandfather was superintendent at the airport, and gave us the numbers to call in the reports. this was on a friday or saturday. on monday, our class had a report due on current events. we were warned by my grandfather not to talk about it, because we might get a 'visit' [he never said by whom]. someone else in the class had the article from the sun paper and used that as his subject matter. i've contacted the archives of the sun, and have checked other papers in the area as well. the washington post was a possiblity but they had no coverage that i could find. the news american has since been purchased by the sun [in 1986] and they had no coverage either. i have not found any information in the project bluebook files, at least not in what's posted online. i am wondering if this may be related to a close encounter at about the same time in canada, where a craft landed in a field and a polish engineer received burns and radiation-like symptoms for touching the craft [it was featured on unsolved mysteries around 1989]
Summary: 1967: UFO sighted near airport in Maryland.
